comments: Currently WTP provides template preference dialogs to support templates within our editors.  We extend the org.eclipse.ui.texteditor.templates.TemplatePreferencePage class and can make our templates viewable with the correct highlighting in the preference page itself, but we are unable to provide the same highlighting when editing our templates because the viewer is created within the dialog.  I'd rather we didn't have to create multiple copies of the dialog for each of our supported languages, or worse, create and then provide our own copy as API.
Would it solve your needs if we provide the EditTemplateDialog as protected class inside TemplatePreferencePage?
Yes, then we'd be able to refer to it enough to override the two usages of it from the superclass.

Hi Nitin, the dialog is now inside the preference page with a minimal set of protected members. Please let me know whether this is good enough or whether you need additional methods changed to protected.
Reopening, requires two other minor changes.

Created an attachment (id=55454)
change to document usage in the editor

Attaching a patch for the remainder of what I'd like.  It makes the template processor visible so that it can be used by other text viewer configurations, and no longer replaces the initial document created for the dialog's text viewer.  I wasn't sure what to do with the doSourceChanged() method now that the text input listener was never going to be notified, but I couldn't tell how/when it was being notified before my changes.
Given that the patch is good and low risk I'll put it into M4 (note that we are already in the testing phase for M4 milestone).
